key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs failed to display 56 % of published fares and still priced 44 % of shown itineraries higher (avg. +1.6 %), eroding web-to-OTA consistency.
Metasearch omitted 58 % of fares and undercut the website on 39 % of non-TR itineraries despite only a 0.1 % average discount, exposing international vulnerability.
GDS lacked 51 % of fares and priced 48 % of available Turkey-origin itineraries higher (avg. +2.1 %), risking home-market share loss.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 56 % of web fares missing on OTAs last week, +4 ppts vs prior periods.
OTAs list higher prices 44 % of the time, avg. markup +1.6 %; true parity is virtually absent.
Turkey-origin itineraries see the largest OTA premium at +2.1 %.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Coverage fell another 3-4 ppts week-over-week, widening the blind spot.
Markup averages 1.64 %, small but visible to price-sensitive shoppers.
OTA lower pricing remains negligible at 0.3 % of checks.

mse_highlights.line_content: Absent fares up 9 ppts MoM, limiting visibility on metasearch.
Exact matches down to 29 %; declines evident both WoW and MoM.
MSE undercuts on 39 % of non-TR itineraries, eight-times domestic rate.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: +3.7 % WoW, +8.8 % MoM—primary driver of lost bookings.
Undercuts modest (-0.10 %) but frequent on key markets.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 55 % missing; MSE lower on 27 % of routes, parity only 18 %.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 53 % missing, parity collapses to 7 %, undercut rises to 39 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: Availability dropped 4 ppts WoW; sales potential suppressed.
Avg. markup +1.7 %; slight easing but still material.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: +4 ppts WoW; half of itineraries un-bookable via agency channel.
Nearly one in two fares dearer, avg. +1.65 %.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 54 % unavailable, premium negligible at +0.09 %; 2.6 % itineraries cheaper.
